intro: Silene pseudoatocion var. ibosii, commonly known as the Ibosii campion, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, often growing in rocky or coastal habitats. It is a perennial species that thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the island's unique climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
